revised_title: David Henry Smyth: A Pioneering Figure in Intestinal Absorption Research
tldr: This article is a biographical memoir of David Henry Smyth, a leading authority on intestinal absorption. Smyth made significant contributions to the field of biochemistry and physiology, including his research on the human placenta and the effects of chronic denervation on respiration in rabbits. He also had a notable career at Queen's University in Belfast and spent a year in Hermann Rein's Institute of Physiology in Göttingen, where he studied renal blood flow with Erich Opitz.
